page.title: 13ELECTRICITY SUB-STATION
page.content: In 1970 the Central Electricity Generating Board bought 75 acres of land,and used 10 acres for an elec- tricity substation.It consists of cir- cuits,switches,transformers and auxi- lary plant buildings,and is connected to the National Grid.It does not pro- duce electricity, but controls it.It is operated from a control room at Watford,but every Spring men come and clear away birds nests etc.The land was originally covered in trees in the middle of Shardeloes game reserve.The shooting rights were bought,and the site has been turned into a nature reserve.The trees were cut down,and hundreds of tons of soil were removed to make a hollow.In 1975 dozens of new pylons were erected and a cable buried.Â£8,000 was spent on trees and grass_but they all died in the 1976 drought and had to be replaced.
